intro: Samolus dichondrifolius, commonly known as the two-leaf willow herb, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically features small, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along its stems. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in early summer. Its flowers are often borne on short pedicels, and the plant is known for its ability to thrive in moist, often calcareous soils. Samolus dichondrifolius is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other flowering plants with showy blooms.
